content.description: Sit start, just left of the Cobra problems.  Climb the huge buckets up and out.  Also the best down-climb in the area.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Work your way up the left side of Cobra boulder on crimps, "snatch" the hanging stalactite feature behind your head, and top out.  To maintain the grade, the left wall is off.
content.location: Left side of Cobra Main.  Your objective is to get to the obvious hanging stalactite feature.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Climb very small  and sharp crimps up and out.  Sit start maybe bumps grade to V4.  The key to sending is high pain tolerance!
content.location: Center of Cobra area.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start near the small ramp R of the cobra problems.  L hand on rail and R in 2 fingered pocket down low.  Climb the tufa-like feature on pinches and slopers and finish out the crack at the top.  The Dimples flake to your right is off.
content.location: Middle of the Cobra-pinch arete area.  Sit start near small, sloping ramp.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description:
(Pinch Arete Left) Sit start.  Work your way up arete and dyno for high jug.  Move far left to the rail after nailing the dyno, and top out.

Alternate finish (Pinch Arete Right) goes right after dyno to jug.  Goes at roughly same grade ~V5/V6.
content.location: Right side of the Cobra/Pinch Arete area.  See beta photo in area description.

content.description: If you start standing with R hand in pocket and left hand on side-pull, this probably goes at V2. Alternatively, you can sit start on the same rail as Fingerlockin', grab a left hand intermediate, then throw R hand into the pocket and go for the sidepull with your L.  The sit probably bumps it to v3-v4.  Use your balance, pull on a few thin crimps and top out.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Stand start.  Climb the right arete/corner of Mail Slot Boulder.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Work hard to establish yourself on the slab face and then try and get to the juggy "Mail Slot."
content.location: First route to the right of the stairs.  See beta pic in route description.

content.description:
Really fun problem!

sit start with left hand in a two finger pocket and right hand on thin crimp and reach high for good pockets.
content.location: This is on Lhotse boulder just right of pinch arete

content.description: A great route! Standing start on a boulder under the Cobra roof.  Work up and left on the obvious flake on great holds.  The feature hanging down to your left, "Snatch Bar", is off.
content.location: Left side of Cobra Main.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Tiptoe up absurdly hard slab.
content.location: RIght side of Fingertip Mantle Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the obvious line of huecos just right of Snakebite.  When the huecos end, undercling and throw for the very fun finish.
content.location: Center of Cobra area.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Start at the base of Crack is Whack.  When the crack cuts Right, continue straight up the face on some suspect, hollow flakes.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start on a rail with a high foot in the hole in the wall, bump R onto new rail, then throw into a flat pocket.  From here, use some footwork trickery and balance to get up and plunge your fingers into the slot in the crack.  A few more fingerlocks and you are home free.  Avoid the McCrimpin holds.
content.location: See beta pick in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Pull hard to gain high hold.  A couple of finger locks and easy moves will get you to the top out.
content.location: Obvious finger crack on Fingertip Mantle Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the left facing flake by liebacking and crimping some of the "dimples" on the face.
content.location: Center of the Cobra area.  See the beta pic in area description.

content.description: A fun, right trending crack just to the Left of the Cobra routes.  Sit start, then follow it to an easy top-out.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Climb the difficult face just to the right of the heavily featured Cobra Center.
content.location: On Cobra Main.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Same start as for King Cobra.  Work your way straight up through the huecos and pockets before throwing to a slopey rail.
Start on chalked up side pulls right of right arete, and go straight up the face.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
